Defaults to `Linux`.<br>  pod\_subnet\_id                = (Optional) The ID of the Subnet where the pods in the Node Pool should exist. Possible values are `Regular` and `Spot`. Defaults to `Regular`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.<br>  proximity\_placement\_group\_id = (Optional) The ID of the Proximity Placement Group where the Virtual Machine Scale Set that powers this Node Pool will be placed. Changing this forces a new resource to be created. When setting `priority` to Spot - you must configure an `eviction_policy`, `spot_max_price` and add the applicable `node_labels` and `node_taints` [as per the Azure Documentation](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/aks/spot-node-pool).<br>  spot\_max\_price               = (Optional) The maximum price you're willing to pay in USD per Virtual Machine. Valid values are `-1` (the current on-demand price for a Virtual Machine) or a positive value with up to five decimal places. Changing this forces a new resource to be created. This field can only be configured when `priority` is set to `Spot`.<br>  scale\_down\_mode              = (Optional) Specifies how the node pool should deal with scaled-down nodes. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.<br>  vnet\_subnet\_id               = (Optional) The ID of the Subnet where this Node Pool should exist.
